subject: Re: [junit] Re: junit on large scale
msgSnippet: Hello Thomas, Wednesday, June 2, 2004, 6:09:50 PM, you wrote: TLR Kevin O Sullivan Tue, 1 Jun 2004 09:42:50 +0100 ... TLR * s/unit//. Don t get hung up on
messageBody:
Hello Thomas,

Wednesday, June 2, 2004, 6:09:50 PM, you wrote:

TLR> "Kevin O'Sullivan" Tue, 1 Jun 2004 09:42:50 +0100
>>>> One of the concerns that I (and developers) have is that we will
>>>> end up with thousands of test cases, many of which will involve
>>>> using substantial amounts of MockObjects to set up test cases and
>>>> that all this will become too much of an overhead to manage
>>>> maintain.


TLR> * s/unit//. Don't get hung up on the "Unit" part of "JUnit"--you can
TLR> Â  indeed use it to drive many other types of testing.

I used to use the xUnits for much more of that higher-level testing,
but now I introduce FIT and Fitnesse to teams I work with:

http://fit.c2.com
http://fitnesse.org

Ergonomically, they are a great match for that level.


Michael Feathers
www.objectmentor.com
